meanings.definition: Transfer from public to private ownership or control.
meanings.sent1: The government decided to privatize the public transportation system.
meanings.sent2: Companies often privatize services to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent3: Why did the magician try to privatize the rabbit out of the hat?
meanings.sent4: Her decision to privatize her emotions made her seem distant.
meanings.sent5: The idea to privatize the garden and keep it all to herself was appealing.

meanings.sent1: She wanted to privatize her diary by adding a lock.
meanings.sent2: The club decided to privatize its events for members only.
meanings.sent3: He tried to privatize the last piece of cake for himself.
meanings.sent4: The artist's goal was to privatize his unique style.
meanings.sent5: The family decided to privatize their beach house for personal use only.
